Package managerpro.Model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
managerpro.Model.Model
public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
This is a class that is used as a intermediary data storage, to provide the controllers access to database and to start a timer for ModelHelper. Model class holds collections of entities and provides CRUD methods for each entity. Internally model uses DAOs to provide the database access. This class is in the larger side, but a necessary step between the database and the controllers, because the project is lacking a backend at this point.
Author:
OTP7

    • support

      private final java.beans.PropertyChangeSupport support
      PropertyChangeSupport. PropertyChangeSupport is used to inform Controllers of any changes that may have happened when modelHelper updates the fields

    • queue

      private final java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<java.lang.Integer> queue
      An ArrayBlockingQueue that is used to prevent concurrent reads and writes of the Entity collections. Prevents race conditions when modelHelper is invoked after INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE and the timed modelHelper task is also updating the fields at same time.

    • sessionFactory

      private static org.hibernate.SessionFactory sessionFactory

    • timer

      private java.util.Timer timer
      Timer for modelHelper scheduling.

    • modelHelper

      private ModelHelper modelHelper
      A modelHelper instance, that is used to pull data periodically from the DB.

    • instance

      private static volatile Model instance

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      private Model()

      Model class constructor. Instantiates Daos, ArrayLists, modelHelper and Timer. Adds PropertyChangeListener to modelHelper Schedules modelHelper to be run every 2 seconds.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Model getInstance() throws java.lang.Exception
      A Method to return an instance of model class. Model is a singleton, so its constructor is private and only way to get instances is to use this method.
      Returns:
      A shared instance of Model class.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown, if Model class has no sessionFactory

    • setSessionFactory

      public static void setSessionFactory​(org.hibernate.SessionFactory sessionFactory)
      A Method for setting a sessionFactory for Model class
      Parameters:
      sessionFactory - a Hibernate session factory, that will be used by DAOs to get database sessions.

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      A simple method that refreshes the fields. Not usually required, the PropertyChangeListeners and individual modelHelpers should do the syncing.

    • disableScheduling

      public void disableScheduling()
      A method to disable the modelHelper scheduling. Not recommended.

    • enableScheduling

      public void enableScheduling()
      A method for re-enabling the scheduling

    • updateFields

      private void updateFields​(java.util.ArrayList lists)

      A method for updating the Entity collections. This method is called in the PropertyChangeListener, and gets a ArrayList of ArrayList as parameter. The ArrayLists are then compared to the fields of the model and an PropertyChange is fired if the list the modelHelper has loaded from database is different from the Models field Database is assumed to have more up-to-date knowledge at any given time.

      Parameters:
      lists - ArrayList of ArrayLists coming from the modelHelper. Order of ArrayList in lists must be Tables, Orders,Reservations,Portions,OrderedPortions

    • startHelper

      private void startHelper​(java.lang.String s)

      A method for starting a new thread to run the modelHelper This updates the fields when user calls the CRUD methods of the Model object ie. No waiting for the scheduled update

      Parameters:
      s - A string that is used to tell the ModelHelper to fetch data of a certain table

      private void rebuildOpMap()
